DOC.brief_summary: Vitamin D deficiency could be a high risk for cardiovascular diseases. It has been recently reported that vitamin D deficiency is another cause of heart failure and cardiomyopathies. It was found that vitamin D supplementation improved the heart function. The purpose of this study is to evaluate patients with idiopathic cardiomyopathies and determine whether vitamin D supplementation in cases where there is a deficiency, improves heart functioning.
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D Supplementation Can Improve Heart Function in Idiopathic Cardiomyopathy
DOC.criteria: Patients with idiopathic cardiomyopathy Post heart surgery Congenital heart disease
